title: Sloppy USMNT performances to blame as U.S. loses yet another Gold Cup final to Mexico
content: The USMNT's first chance to win a trophy under coach Mauricio Pochettino slipped away as it played poorly against Mexico in the Gold Cup final.

title: Nats seek 'fresh approach,' fire Martinez, Rizzo
content: Headed into an off day and stuck in last place in the NL East, the Washington Nationals fired manager Dave Martinez and general manager Mike Rizzo on Sunday night, hours after a 6-4 loss at home completed a sweep by the Boston Red Sox.

title: Poch: USMNT Gold Cup lessons 'priceless, painful'
content: United States coach Maurico Pochettino said his team had learned "priceless" lessons despite a "painful" 2-1 loss to rival Mexico during Sunday's Gold Cup final.

title: Rollins agrees to 3-year deal to return to Bucks
content: Free agent guard Ryan Rollins has agreed to a three-year, $12 million deal to return to the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: Kershaw gets special ASG invite; no Soto, Betts
content: The MLB All-Star Game rosters will feature 19 first-timers -- and special commissioner's pick Clayton Kershaw -- as the pitchers and reserves were announced Sunday.

content: The Denver Nuggets have informed Jonas Valanciunas ' representatives that the franchise fully expects the center to honor his contract, sources said.

title: Two-time champ Alonso declines HR Derby invite
content: Two-time champ Pete Alonso of the Mets told reporters Sunday that he will skip the Home Run Derby in Atlanta, adding, "I have never really fully enjoyed the three off days, so I just want to be in the best possible position to help this team win."

title: Pirates CF Cruz makes 105.2 mph throw to plate
content: Pirates center fielder Oneil Cruz made a 105.2 mph throw to nab Seattle's J.P. Crawford at the plate on Sunday, the second-hardest thrown ball to produce an outfield assist since Statcast started tracking in 2015.

content: The two leaders agreed to work on issues of concern to the global South, including in the areas of health, pandemics and climate change.

content: According to IMD‚Äôs latest bulletin, heavy rainfall is very likely at isolated places in Adilabad, Kumaram Bheem Asifabad, Mancherial, Nirmal, Nizamabad, Jayashankar Bhupalpally and Mulugu districts.

title: Lokesh lauds teachers for enrolling their children in government schools
content: Minister for Human Resources Development (HRD) Nara Lokesh on Sunday praised government schoolteachers, who are not only promoting public education but also enrolling their own children in government schools.

content: Addressing the delegation of the candidates appearing for the Assistant Professor exam, former Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda said that ‚Äúpaper leaks, copy-paste exams and scams have become synonymous with the recruitments conducted under the BJP government‚Äù.

content: "From West Asia to Europe, today the world is surrounded by disputes and tensions. The humanitarian situation in Gaza is a cause of great concern," he said.

content: The government asked the Elon Musk-owned platform for an explanation and said it had not sought such a move

content: A state-of-the-art eye care facility begins operations at Vadapalani, serving Chennai and nearby regions

content: Ahead of his state-wide tour, to begin in Coimbatore on July 7, he says people of Tamil Nadu want change and are preparing to send home the DMK government

content: Apart from posting online cooking videos, Cookd offers a wide range of products ranging from biryani kits, masalas, cooking pastes, and ready-to-use recipe kits

title: Over 500 dogs vaccinated at NTR vet hospital on World Zoonosis Day
content: Timely vaccination of domestic animals and maintaining hygiene will help prevent transmission of diseases from animals to humans, says Special Chief Secretary B. Rajasekhar

title: How safe do women in Kolkata feel?
content: Less than a year after the rape and murder of a doctor at R.G. Kar Medical College and Hospital created a nationwide outrage, another allegation of sexual assault inside a law college has shaken the people of Kolkata once more.¬†Moyurie Som, Shrabana Chatterjee,¬†and¬†Shiv Sahay Singh¬†look at how safe women in West Bengal‚Äôs Capital feel, in the city with India‚Äôs lowest reported crime against women for some years now

title: MedLEaPR portal launched to issue MLC and PMR in Karnataka
content: All the medical officers and doctors involved in the issuance of MLC or PMR in hospitals under the Health and Family Welfare Services should be registered on the MedLEaPR portal

title: IIIT-B student gets record ‚Çπ1.45 crore package as institute celebrates silver jubilee convocation
content: This was announced during the Silver Jubilee Convocation Ceremony held on the IIIT-B campus, where 372 students graduated across various programmes

content: Police say incident was pre-planned; several personnel injured as ceremonial horse collapses after barricade breach

content: Named Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan Vidyarthi Mithra Kits, they have undergone a three-stage quality check before distribution, and cost govt. ‚Çπ953.71 crore

title: No immediate danger to Srisailam dam gates, says expert
content: Stating that leakage is less than 10% from gate No. 10, A.P. Govt. Advisor Kannaiah Naidu suggests repair and repainting of gates and proper maintenance to extend their life

title: Palakkad, Malappuram administrations step up vigil against Nipah
content: 383 persons in the State are under observation, says Health Minister. Additional ICU and isolation facilities set up in Palakkad, Malappuram and Kozhikode to prepare for a potential surge in patients

title: Rayaraddi says media distorted his remarks on guarantee schemes, infrastructure funding
content: This comes after he indicated that the govt. is facing difficulty in funding infrastructure projects due to the large outlay for guarantee schemes

title: Environment impact study for Great Nicobar project downplays earthquake risk
content: Report says the probability of another mega earthquake, such as the one that led to the 2004 tsunami, is ‚Äòlow‚Äô; however, an IIT-Kanpur report had pointed to uncertainty in ‚Äòprediction of future earthquakes‚Äô;¬†professor who led the IIT study urges infra planners to conduct ‚Äòsite-specific study‚Äô

title: CPI(M) directs rank and file to defend Veena George
content: Directive comes in the wake of some party members in the Health Minister‚Äôs home district, Pathanamthitta, criticising the Minister‚Äôs style of functioning on social media.¬†The Minister is at the centre of a political storm after a building collapse at MCH killed a caregiver

title: Chief Election Commissioner defends SIR in Bihar, ECI says no change in instructions
content: Election Commission of India clarifies after an advertisement published by the Bihar Chief Electoral Officer states that submission of enumeration forms can be done without the documents; Opposition leaders had said that the advertisement showed the poll panel had backtracked under pressure from them

title: 'Heartfelt tribute': Pak honours Kargil 'hero' it once disowned; had refused to accept body in 1999
content: Pakistan's army chief honored Captain Karnal Sher Khan, a Kargil war "martyr," despite initially refusing to accept his body after it was found on Tiger Hill. India stated that Pakistan denied acknowledging its army's involvement in Kargil, refusing to identify Khan to conceal their role and disservice the families of their soldiers.

title: B'luru youth stripped, thrashed for sending obscene messages to minor girl
content: In Hesargatta, Bengaluru, nine individuals, including a minor girl, were arrested for kidnapping, stripping, and assaulting a youth. The victim allegedly sent obscene messages to the 17-year-old girl, who had previously been in a relationship with him. The girl shared the messages with her new boyfriend, leading to the kidnapping and assault on June 30.

title: Musk posts 'arrest counter' of Epstein case; fresh dig at Trump?
content: Elon Musk posted an "arrest counter" on X, highlighting zero arrests in the Jeffrey Epstein case, seemingly targeting Donald Trump. This follows reports that the DOJ and FBI found no evidence Epstein was murdered or blackmailed powerful figures. Musk previously alleged Trump's name appears in sealed documents related to the case.

title: All-party MPs forum writes Centre to confer Dalai Lama with Bharat Ratna
content: Indian MPs from various parties are backing the Dalai Lama. They want him to receive the Bharat Ratna. The MPs also want him to address the Parliament. They oppose China's interference in Tibetan spiritual matters. The forum supports a pro-Tibet bill. They are also pushing for better amenities for Tibetan settlements. This action highlights India's ongoing diplomatic challenge with China.

title: 'Tariffs being used as tool of coercion': China responds to Trump‚Äôs threat to Brics
content: China has firmly responded to President Trump's threat of additional tariffs on BRICS nations, asserting that such measures are unproductive and serve no constructive purpose. Beijing emphasized that the BRICS bloc is dedicated to cooperation and inclusive global development, rejecting confrontation and geopolitical rivalry. The Chinese Foreign Ministry reiterated its opposition to using tariffs as a tool for political coercion.

title: Tesla board urged to question Eleon Musk by former DOGE adviser
content: Former DOGE advisor James Fishback is critical of Elon Musk's decision to form the America Party, citing concerns about Musk's focus on Tesla. Fishback's firm, Azoria Partners, has postponed the launch of its Tesla ETF due to potential conflicts with Musk's CEO responsibilities. US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent also suggested Musk should prioritize his companies over political endeavors.

title: Hindi row: Why Uddhav Sena has distanced itself from Stalin's hardline stance?
content: Following a rare show of unity against "Hindi imposition," Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin sought support from Uddhav Thackeray. However, Shiv Sena (UBT) distanced itself from DMK's radical stance, clarifying their opposition is against forced imposition, not the language itself. With BMC elections approaching, BJP aims to consolidate North Indian voters in Mumbai.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Very tempting to play Kuldeep, but ...': Gill explains selection call
content: Shubman Gill explained Washington Sundar's inclusion over Kuldeep Yadav was to strengthen batting depth, a decision vindicated by Sundar's all-round performance in India's historic Edgbaston win. Gill highlighted the importance of spin in controlling the game when the Dukes ball softens, and his aggressive strategies during England's innings. He dismissed the Edgbaston jinx, crediting dedicated Test preparation for his form.

title: 10-min delivery: Cost of convenience & what happens when discounts vanish
content: Quick commerce platforms like Swiggy Instamart and Blinkit are facing consumer pushback due to rising fees, including handling, delivery, and surge charges. This is prompting shoppers to compare prices with local vendors and plan purchases to avoid extra costs.

title: GitHub CEO: 'Smartest' firms will hire more software engineers, not fewer
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke suggests that companies leveraging AI effectively will increase developer hiring to capitalize on AI-driven productivity gains. He argues AI serves as a multiplier for engineering talent, making developers more efficient and creating demand for skilled professionals. Dohmke dismisses the idea that AI alone can build successful businesses without substantial coding knowledge.

title: BJP says Chirag Paswan's LJP will contest as ally in Bihar; Cong's 'weather scientist' dig
content: Chirag Paswan's announcement to field LJP candidates for all 243 Bihar seats has stirred reactions. BJP interprets Paswan's move as contesting within the NDA, anticipating a united front. Conversely, Congress predicts Paswan's departure from the NDA post-election, foreseeing a BJP defeat under Nitish Kumar's leadership. LJP's past performance highlights its potential to influence election outcomes, particularly impacting JD(U) prospects.

title: Hoping for a US H-1B visa? Trump administration's stringent scrutiny likely
content: Indian H-1B visa aspirants should brace for potential challenges under Donald Trump's second term, experts warn. Anticipate increased rejection rates, mirroring trends from his initial presidency, alongside extended processing times and more rigorous documentation requests.

title: WTC: India open account with record Edgbaston win; Australia top early standings
content: Shubman Gill's captaincy led India to a dominant 336-run victory over England at Edgbaston, marking their first win in the ongoing five-match Test series and earning them 12 WTC points. This victory, India's biggest-ever away Test win, levels the series at 1-1. Australia currently lead the WTC standings with a perfect PCT, while India and England are joint-third.

title: Infosys HR notice: IT giant sends 'detailed warning email' to employees
content: Infosys is sending personalized warnings to employees exceeding standard work hours, a move contrasting founder Narayana Murthy's call for a 70-hour workweek. The company's automated system tracks remote work, alerting employees working beyond 9 hours and 15 minutes daily. This policy shift prioritizes employee well-being and work-life balance amidst health concerns in the IT sector.

title: 'They asked me to raze house': PMAY glitch forces 80 y/o widow to live under tree
content: Gaura Bai, an 80-year-old widow from Madhya Pradesh, faces homelessness due to a software glitch in the PM Awas Yojna. After being instructed to demolish her mud house in anticipation of a new one, she and her family have been living under a tree for ten months.

title: Chess | ‚ÄòCarlsen‚Äôs respect for Gukesh is only going to grow‚Äô ‚Äì What does it even mean?
content: Magnus Carlsen secured victory at the Super United Rapid and Blitz in Croatia, overshadowing reigning World Champion Gukesh Dommaraju. Despite Carlsen's recent criticisms and subtle jabs towards Gukesh's abilities, the young challenger has consistently responded with strong performances on the board. This rivalry marks a significant transition in world chess, reminiscent of Carlsen's own rise to challenge established legends.

title: Bilawal Bhutto's extradition 'offer': Hafiz Saeed‚Äôs son fumes; LeT lashes out
content: Bilawal Bhutto's offer to extradite Pakistani terrorists to India has sparked outrage, particularly from Talha Saeed, son of Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Saeed. Talha condemned Bhutto's remarks as an "irresponsible offer," demanding instead the extradition of Indian leaders and accusing Bhutto's family of aligning with Western and Indian narratives against Pakistan.

title: Russell Wilson‚Äôs wife Ciara celebrates his Marvel debut
content: Ciara supports Russell Wilson as his clothing label, 3BRAND, appears in Marvel's Ironheart. The brand made its TV debut in the Disney+ series. Wilson shared his excitement on social media. Ciara also expressed her pride. 3BRAND's appearance raises its profile in fashion and entertainment. The couple's business bond continues to grow. Their influence has now reached a global superhero stage.

title: 'Boosted momentum': Pirate Software as Stop Killing Games hits 1 million signatures
content: The Stop Killing Games petition surpassed a million signatures, fueled by an unexpected twist. Pirate Software's criticism sparked a social media backlash, ironically boosting the movement as supporters rallied against his perceived villain narrative. Despite his claims of minimal impact, the controversy surrounding his stance unified SKG advocates, injecting fresh energy into the campaign.

title: Was Yung Miami warning Cardi B the whole time? Stefon Diggs drama explodes online
content: Cardi B has removed all traces of Stefon Diggs from her Instagram account. This action has fueled speculation about a breakup. Fans are recalling a past warning from Yung Miami. Miami had previously labeled Diggs a "hoe" in a tweet. This tweet is now seen as a warning to Cardi B. Cardi B and Diggs were rumored to be dating. Fans believe Cardi B ignored red flags. The internet is buzzing with theories about the split. Some suggest Diggs was a rebound after Offset. The situation remains unconfirmed. Fans are closely watching for further developments.

title: IND v ENG: 'I'd be worried ...': Broad's stern warning for England ahead of Lord's Test
content: India secured a massive win against England, leveling the series 1-1. The third Test shifts to Lord's. Stuart Broad highlights India's potent bowling attack, especially with Jasprit Bumrah's return. Shubman Gill's team is confident after their Edgbaston triumph. England focuses on strengthening their pace options. All eyes are on how England will counter India's revitalized pace attack.

title: Earn above Rs 12 lakh? Top 5 ways to make your retirement plan tax-efficient
content: The tax treatment of many retirement products has changed in recent years. Find out how to get past these changes to make your nest egg tax efficient.

title: IND vs ENG: 'India too good, but ‚Ä¶' - Vaughan stands by 3-1 England prediction
content: Despite India's commanding 336-run victory at Edgbaston, levelling the five-match series 1-1, Michael Vaughan maintains his pre-series prediction of a 3-1 win for England. Vaughan criticised England's regression and reliance on fortune, while Stuart Broad highlighted the threat of India's bowling attack, urging England to reassess before the Lord's Test.

title: Telangana factory tragedy: Toll rises to 42 at Sigachi; 8 still missing
content: The Sigachi Industries blast death toll has tragically climbed to 42 with the passing of Jitendra Kumar and the identification of Chikkan Singh through DNA analysis. Eight individuals remain missing following the devastating incident. Out of the 33 initially injured, 14 have been discharged, while 18 are still receiving medical care in various city hospitals, as confirmed by Sigachi Industries.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Be in love with the grind': Gill's post sums up India's historic win
content: Shubman Gill's stellar batting performance, including becoming the first batter to score 250 and 150 in the same match, and Akash Deep's 10-wicket haul powered India to a record-breaking 336-run victory over England at Edgbaston. Gill's captaincy debut marked India's first win at the venue since 1967, leveling the series 1-1.

title: Aamir Khan names Vishnu Vishal and Jwala Gutta‚Äôs newborn daughter Mira
content: Tamil actor Vishnu Vishal and his wife, ace badminton player and Arjuna awardee Jwala Gutta, have revealed the name of their newborn daughter, Mira. The couple, who welcomed their baby girl on April 22, held a special naming ceremony in Hyderabad that was graced by Bollywood superstar Aamir Khan. What made the occasion even more special was that Aamir didn‚Äôt just attend the event, he named the baby.

title: Airlines alarmed by DCGA's new medical test rule for pilots
content: India's DGCA has mandated that commercial pilots undergo medical tests exclusively at Indian Air Force centers, raising concerns among airlines. This decision, prompted by a cardiac arrest incident, aims to prevent falsified medical records.

title: Scientists discover a 'second Earth' twice the size of our planet near a red dwarf star
content: In a groundbreaking discovery, astronomers have identified TOI-1846 b, a super-Earth exoplanet located 154 light-years away. This planet, nearly twice Earth's size, orbits a red dwarf star and exhibits a potentially water-rich composition. Although its high temperature precludes habitability, TOI-1846 b offers valuable insights into the formation of rocky planets.

title: Bihar voter list row: Oppn vs EC intensifies; SC to hear pleas against SIR
content: The Supreme Court has agreed to an early hearing on petitions challenging the Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, scheduled for Thursday. Opposition parties RJD and Congress, along with the Association for Democratic Reforms, argue the revision could disenfranchise lakhs, particularly marginalized communities, due to strict citizenship documentation requirements within a short timeframe.

title: Maha security scare: Suspicious boat spotted off Raigad coast; cops on alert
content: A suspicious boat, potentially a Pakistani fishing vessel, was detected near Maharashtra's Raigad coast, triggering a large-scale search operation involving multiple security agencies. Heightened coastal surveillance and security measures have been implemented due to concerns arising from the region's history, particularly the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Deserves that smile' - Shastri lauds Gambhir as India's bold call pays off
content: Ravi Shastri questioned resting Jasprit Bumrah for the Edgbaston Test, but India's bowlers, led by Akash Deep and Mohammed Siraj, secured a historic win. Gautam Gambhir's team management saw their bold selection calls vindicated as India leveled the series 1-1. Shubman Gill praised Akash Deep's performance, confirming Bumrah's return for the Lord's Test.

title: Bank holiday for Muharram 2025: Are banks open or closed today?
content: Bank Holiday for Muharram 2025: There was uncertainty about banking services on July 7, 2025, due to confusion over the Muharram holiday. The official government calendar stated Muharram was on July 6, 2025. Therefore, banks are open on July 7.

title: Mars in just 15 years? European Space Agency‚Äôs bold plan
content: The European Space Agency (ESA) has revealed an ambitious plan to establish human settlements on Mars within 15 years. ESA's vision includes self-sustaining habitats, AI-driven farming, and in-space manufacturing, aiming to create a solar system economy. While challenges remain, ESA believes collaboration and technological advancements could make this multi-planetary dream a reality by 2040.

title: 'Any country aligning with anti-American policies of Brics ... ': Trump's warning
content: Donald Trump threatened Brics nations with an additional 10% tariff for aligning with what he termed "anti-American policies," following India's signing of a Brics declaration condemning US tariff measures. He announced the delivery of tariff letters to various countries and previously threatened 100% tariffs if Brics moved to replace the US dollar.

title: Gold rate outlook for July 7, 2025 week - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices may fluctuate due to US tariff policies and trade deal uncertainties. The July 9 deadline and potential tariffs on BRICS nations are key factors. Easing US-China trade tensions and a possible Iran-Israel ceasefire have impacted gold's safe-haven appeal.

title: Karnataka NEET UG Counselling 2025 starts: KEA opens roll number enrollment
content: The Karnataka Examinations Authority (KEA) has begun roll number enrollment for NEET UG 2025 counselling, a key requirement for state quota admissions in medical, dental, and AYUSH courses. Candidates must complete the process by 11 am on July 8. Fresh applicants can register from July 7 to 10, with verification details to be announced separately.

title: Kolkata rape: 18 witnesses, bedsheet, DNA; 'enough evidence for water-tight case'
content: Kolkata police, investigating the law college gang-rape case, believe they have sufficient evidence for a strong case and plan to request an extension of police custody for the four accused. Investigators have recorded 18 witness testimonies, reconstructed the crime scene, and seized key physical evidence, including DNA samples and CCTV footage.

title: WATCH: Kaat de? MS Dhoni seeks permission before cutting cake on birthday
content: MS Dhoni celebrated his 44th birthday in Ranchi, a video capturing him politely seeking permission before cutting his cake went viral. Dhoni's illustrious career includes leading India to victory in the 2011 Cricket World Cup and the 2013 Champions Trophy. He also captained India in the 2007 ICC T20 World Cup.

title: Espionage accused Jyoti Malhotra visited Kerala on official invitation, reveals RTI
content: Jyoti Malhotra, a vlogger arrested for espionage, had previously been invited to Kerala as part of a tourism promotion initiative. The Kerala tourism department covered her expenses during visits to various cities. Kerala's tourism minister denies knowingly inviting individuals involved in espionage, dismissing allegations from a BJP leader regarding Malhotra's invitation.

title: 'Fake narrative': Professor guided Pune woman on false rape complaint
content: Pune's police commissioner refuted claims of deteriorating law and order after a woman's rape complaint was found to be false and misleading. Investigations revealed inconsistencies in her account, including a consensual encounter and a self-authored threat message. The woman, an IT professional, has been referred to counselling, and a professor who advised her is also being questioned.

title: Parag Tyagi refutes rumours about dog Simba‚Äôs health after Shefali's demise
content: Following Shefali Jariwala's death, concerns arose about her pet Simba's well-being. Her husband, Parag Tyagi, shared a video assuring everyone that Simba is healthy and participating in post-death rituals. Parag and Simba were seen distributing food to the needy, seeking blessings.

title: Suicide or murder? DOJ, FBI drop big update on Jeffrey Epstein death
content: A DOJ and FBI memo concludes Jeffrey Epstein's death was a suicide, dismissing murder and blackmail conspiracy theories. Investigators found no evidence of a client list or blackmailing of powerful figures. The administration is releasing enhanced video footage from Epstein's prison cell to support the suicide conclusion, aiming to dispel widespread online speculation.

title: Manish Sisodia, Satyendar Jain, Vijay Nair: The new 'power centres' of Punjab AAP
content: Following AAP's defeat in Delhi, the party's central leadership is focusing on Punjab, its only governed state. Senior leaders Manish Sisodia and Satyendra Jain are now overseeing key portfolios, leading to concerns about Delhi's influence and rising corruption. The BJP criticizes this "outsourcing" of governance, while AAP defends it as guidance for the benefit of Punjab.

title: Brics backs India line on Pahalgam & UNSC reforms, slams tariffs
content: The Brics summit in Rio saw strong condemnation of the Pahalgam terrorist attack. Member nations urged concerted action against UN-designated terrorists. They also supported comprehensive reform of the UN Security Council. India joined Brics in criticizing attacks on Iran. The declaration expressed grave concern about the situation in the Occupied Palestinian territory.

title: "I Saved Mumbai On 26/11, Where Were Raj Thackeray's Warriors?" Ex-Commando
content: A former elite commando part of the 26/11 counter-terrorist operation has ripped into the Thackerays over the Marathi language row, claiming that the supporters of Raj Thackeray were busy hiding when the terror unfolded in Mumbai in 2008.

title: Actor Mahesh Babu Gets Legal Notice In Rs 34 Lakh Real Estate Fraud Case
content: Mahesh Babu has been named as the third respondent in the case, with the complaint asserting that his public endorsement significantly influenced potential buyers.

title: South Calcutta Law College, Where Student Was Gang-Raped, Reopens
content: South Calcutta Law College reopened on Monday amid heavy security after remaining closed for over a week following the gang rape of a student on campus.

title: Oldest Rock On Earth Confirmed To Be Over 4 Billion Years Old
content: Earth formed about 4.6 billion years ago, during the geological eon known as the Hadean. The name "Hadean" comes from the Greek god of the underworld, reflecting the extreme heat that likely characterized the planet at the time.

title: Tahawwur Rana Was Declared Deserter By Pak Army. How He Went On To Plot 26/11
content: Tahawwur Hussain Rana, the key conspirator in the 26/11 Mumbai attacks who was extradited to India after a long diplomatic battle, has revealed crucial details about the planning behind the 2008 terror strike that left over 170 people dead.

title: Parents, Grandmother Swept Away, 11-Month-Old Girl Survives In Himachal
content: According to the girl's uncle, they have received many calls in the past few days for the baby's adoption. But, they refused to give her away.

title: School Girl Drops Out After Father's Accident. How Yogi Adityanath Helped Her
content: The girl met Yogi Adityanath at a 'Janta Darshan' (a public grievance redressal program) in Gorakhpur on July 1 and appealed for financial support.

title: All About UAE's New Golden Visa For Indians: Eligibility, Perks And More
content: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has made the 10-year residency more accessible to professionals across sectors.

title: First Session Of Hamas-Israel Ceasefire Ended Inconclusively: Report
content: The first session of indirect Hamas-Israel ceasefire talks in Qatar ended inconclusively, adding that the Israeli delegation didn't have a sufficient mandate to reach an agreement with Hamas.

title: South Korea's Balloon Crackdown Hits Anti-North Korea Activists
content: The equipment activist Lee Min-bok uses to send balloons laden with anti-Kim Jong Un leaflets across the border from South Korea unto the North has been gathering dust and cobwebs for months.

title: Forest Rangers Feared Elephant Won't Accept Separated Calf. They Did This
content: A two-month-old elephant calf that got separated from its herd in Assam's Kaziranga National Park has finally been reunited with its mother.

title: "Bodies On Trees, Fish Rotting On Banks": Scenes Of Flood Destruction In Texas
content: The search and rescue teams plodded through mud-laden riverbanks and flew aircraft over the flood-stricken landscape of central Texas in the United States for a fourth day on Monday, searching for scores of people still missing.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Received Standing Ovation From Inmates After Verdict
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs got a standing ovation from fellow inmates when the music mogul returned to jail after winning acquittals on potential life-in-prison charges

title: How Happy Pasia Made It Big In World Of Crime, Became Khalistani Terrorist
content: Harpreet Singh, alias Happy Pasia, smuggled liquor in his younger days, but his ambitions knew no bounds. Aspiring to make it big in the criminal world, he befriended the world's worst, including terrorists and gangsters.

title: Supreme Court Refuses Interim Stay On Election Body's Bihar Roll Revision
content: The Supreme Court will hear on Thursday the challenge against the Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the voter list in poll-bound Bihar. The court accepted the petitioners' request for an urgent hearing in the matter.

title: Brighter Night-Time Light Exposure Linked To Higher Heart Disease Risk
content: Are you in the habit of sleeping with lights on during the night? Beware, a study led by an international team of researchers found that brighter night-time light exposure may increase the risks of five major cardiovascular diseases.

title: Minors Harassed And Filmed With Communal Remarks, 2 Arrested In Karnataka
content: Two men have been arrested for allegedly harassing two minors and circulating a video with communal remarks on social media in Puttur town of Dakshina Kannada district, police said on Monday.

title: Mother And Son Arrested For Kidnapping 6-Year-Old In Gurugram
content: Mother and son who kidnapped a child from Gurugram Sector 40, were arrested by anti-human trafficking branch of Gurugram Police, in Agra. The duo planned on selling the child to rich childless couples in exchange of money.

title: Orioles' lineup gets a boost; Chapman set to return for Giants
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the Sunday afternoon slate is lighter than usual with three evening affairs, including two evening affairs . first is at 6:10 p.m. ET in Wrigley Field with the Chicago Cubs hosting the St. Louis Cardinals and the San Diego Padres entertaining the Texas Rangers .

title: Nine players who will score more TDs in 2025
content: 169 instances in which a wide receiver or tight end scored fewer than five touchdowns on 50-plus offensive touches before managing at least 50 touches the very next season . of those 169, 114 (67.5%) scored more touchdowns the next season, focusing in on the 48 players in that group who scored less than three touchdowns during the first year .

title: Messi's brilliant brace helps Miami rout Montreal
content: Inter Miami beat CF Montreal 4-1 in their first MLS game in over a month . Lionel Messi scored twice to help the hosts to a 4-1 win . the hosts were eliminated last week in a 4-0 defeat to Paris saint-Germain .

title: NBA free agency: LeBron's next move, Denver's deals, more intel
content: the lakers are holding about $8 million with the remains of their midlevel exception . leBron James chose not to be a free agent during the opening week of free agency . olympic gold medalist robert mccarthy is a top free agent . the los Angeles lakers have been holding about $1.5 million in free agency this summer .

title: PSG adapt to adversity to oust Bayern Munich at Club World Cup
content: Paris Saint Germain beat Bayern Munich 2-0 in club world cup semifinals . champions league holders PSG come face-to-face with the 2024-25 Bundesliga champions in new york . despite two red cards, 2-0 victory could have been the final at the MetLife Stadium on July 13 . the semifinals could be the final of the match at the metlife stadium .

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Profar comes back strong? Crawford leads league in steals? Don't be surprised
content: if any of these thoughts come true, don't be surprised . if a fantasy season comes true, it's a legitimately valuable fantasy season for sure . it was his first game back in the lineup, his first time playing since the first week of the season.

title: One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: this year's deadline is going to be complicated . only eight teams are more than five games out of a wild card . it might make for a slow deadline if all those clubs remain in contention by the end of July .

title: Steve Cohen, Hal Steinbrenner and the battle for NYC supremacy
content: the Rays and blue Jays are closing in on the Yankees in the AL East race . the rivalry between the two franchises has reached a point that those who have lived the rivalries were skeptical they'd ever see . "the Mets have kind of turned the corner from being that little cousin or little brother or sister," says showalter . they have followed parallel paths so far this season .

title: Piastri penalty: Did stewards' inconsistency cost him British GP win?
content: Oscar Piastri has claimed his first ever victory at the British Grand Prix . he responded to countless questions about the 10-second penalty that cost him victory . but he refused to elaborate on the true feelings no doubt seething inside . his ebullient teammate, race winner lando norris, had to wait alone for 25 minutes .
